snippet: There is a mournful stillness in the industrial city of Ansan, where nearly three quarters of a high school’s 11th graders died in the ferry disaster.
abstract: Ansan Journal; South Korean city of Ansan is suffocating in grief since ferry disaster that claimed the lives of 250 of its children; residents describe a mournful stillness, punctuated by the seemingly endless arrival of long funeral processions paying their last respects at the children's school; there have been 150 funerals so far.
lead_paragraph: There is a mournful stillness in the industrial city of Ansan, where nearly three quarters of a high school’s 11th graders died in the ferry disaster.

headline.print_headline: A Shaken Korean City Faces Up to the Unthinkable: 250 Teenage Funerals
headline.main: A Korean City With 250 Holes in Its Heart
